parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> local </value></part><part><name>Multiplayer Arguments</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Object Manipulation </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Returns the target assigned to an unit or the vehicle's [[effectiveCommander]]. The target can be assigned by the group/vehicle/formation leader (as player via [[Arma 3 Field Manual - Commanding#Target_Assignment|quick command menu]] or [[Operation Flashpoint: Commander Guide#TARGET .282.29|"target" complex command menu]]).<br>
To unassign the target use [[doWatch]] [[objNull]] or [[commandWatch]] [[objNull]] or as player and group leader order "no target" in the [[Operation Flashpoint: Commander Guide#TARGET .282.29|"target" complex command menu]].
<template lineStart="1"><title>Informative </title><part><name index="1"/><value>
* This command does not return the target a unit is actually engaging ("attack unit"). For this information, see [[getAttackTarget]].
* If a player is inside a vehicle as the [[effectiveCommander]], the vehicle's crew assignedTarget will always be [[objNull]].
</value></part></template> </value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> '''assignedTarget''' vehicleName </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> vehicleName: [[Object]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Object]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_target = [[assignedTarget]] _T72</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[commandTarget]], [[doTarget]], [[commandWatch]], [[doWatch]], [[effectiveCommander]], [[setEffectiveCommander]]  </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>

</value></part></template>
